title.en: Biographies of Ji Bu and Luan Bu
title.raw: 《季布欒布列傳》 Biographies of Ji Bu and Luan Bu

sentences.zh: 季布者，楚人也。

translations.literal: Ji Bu was a Chu person.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu was a man of Chu.

sentences.zh: 為氣任俠，有名於楚。

translations.literal: For spirit undertook knight-errantry, had reputation in Chu.
translations.idiomatic: He was spirited and acted as a knight-errant, gaining great renown in Chu.

sentences.zh: 項籍使將兵，數窘漢王。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji caused lead troops, repeatedly distressed Han King.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji sent him to command troops, and he repeatedly put the Han King in dire straits.

sentences.zh: 及項羽滅，高祖購求布千金，敢有舍匿，罪及三族。

translations.literal: When Xiang Yu extinguished, Gaozu bounty sought Bu thousand gold, dared have harbor conceal, crime implicated three clans.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Yu was destroyed, Gaozu offered a thousand pieces of gold for Ji Bu's capture, and anyone who dared harbor or conceal him would have their crime implicate three generations of their clan.

sentences.zh: 季布匿濮陽周氏。

translations.literal: Ji Bu concealed Puyang Zhou clan.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu hid with the Zhou family in Puyang.

sentences.zh: 周氏曰：「漢購將軍急，跡且至臣家，將軍能聽臣，臣敢獻計；

translations.literal: Zhou clan said: 'Han bounty general urgent, traces about reach minister's home, general can listen minister, minister dares offer plan;
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou family said, 'The Han bounty for the general is urgent, and traces are about to reach our home. If the general can listen to me, I dare to offer a plan;'

sentences.zh: 即不能，願先自剄。」

translations.literal: Namely cannot, wish first self slit throat.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, we wish to slit our own throats first.'

sentences.zh: 季布許之。

translations.literal: Ji Bu permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu agreed to this.

sentences.zh: 乃髡鉗季布，衣褐衣，置廣柳車中，并與其家僮數十人，之魯朱家所賣之。

translations.literal: Then shaved clamped Ji Bu, clothed coarse cloth clothes, placed wide willow cart middle, together with his household slaves several tens people, went Lu Zhu Jia place sold him.
translations.idiomatic: They shaved Ji Bu's head, fitted him with an iron collar, dressed him in coarse hemp clothing, placed him in a wide willow cart, and along with several dozen of his household slaves, took him to be sold to Zhu Jia of Lu.

sentences.zh: 朱家心知是季布，乃買而置之田。

translations.literal: Zhu Jia heart knew was Ji Bu, then bought and placed him fields.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Jia recognized in his heart that this was Ji Bu, so he bought him and put him to work in the fields.

sentences.zh: 誡其子曰：「田事聽此奴，必與同食。」

translations.literal: Admonished his son said: 'Field affairs listen this slave, must with same eat.'
translations.idiomatic: He admonished his son, saying, 'In field affairs, listen to this slave, and you must eat together with him.'

sentences.zh: 朱家乃乘軺車之洛陽，見汝陰侯滕公。

translations.literal: Zhu Jia then rode light carriage went Luoyang, saw Ruyin Hou Teng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Jia then rode in a light carriage to Luoyang and saw the Marquis of Ruyin, Teng Gong.

sentences.zh: 滕公留朱家飲數日。

translations.literal: Teng Gong detained Zhu Jia drank several days.
translations.idiomatic: Teng Gong detained Zhu Jia and feasted him for several days.

sentences.zh: 因謂滕公曰：「季布何大罪，而上求之急也？」

translations.literal: Then said to Teng Gong: 'Ji Bu what great crime, and Sovereign seek him urgent?'
translations.idiomatic: Then he said to Teng Gong, 'What great crime has Ji Bu committed, that the Sovereign seeks him so urgently?'

sentences.zh: 滕公曰：「布數為項羽窘上，上怨之，故必欲得之。」

translations.literal: Teng Gong said: 'Bu repeatedly for Xiang Yu distressed Sovereign, Sovereign resented him, therefore must want obtain him.'
translations.idiomatic: Teng Gong said, 'Ji Bu repeatedly distressed the Sovereign for Xiang Yu, so the Sovereign resents him and therefore must have him.'

sentences.zh: 朱家曰：「君視季布何如人也？」

translations.literal: Zhu Jia said: 'You sir regard Ji Bu what kind person?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Jia said, 'What kind of man do you consider Ji Bu to be?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「賢者也。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Worthy person.'
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'A worthy man.'

sentences.zh: 朱家曰：「臣各為其主用，季布為項籍用，職耳。

translations.literal: Zhu Jia said: 'Ministers each for their lord use, Ji Bu for Xiang Ji use, duty only.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Jia said, 'Each minister serves his own lord. Ji Bu served Xiang Ji—that was merely his duty.'

sentences.zh: 項氏臣可盡誅邪？

translations.literal: Xiang clan ministers can all execute?
translations.idiomatic: Should all Xiang Yu's ministers be executed?

sentences.zh: 今上始得天下，獨以己之私怨求一人，何示天下之不廣也！

translations.literal: Now Sovereign begins obtained tianxia, alone with self private resentment seek one person, what show tianxia not broad!
translations.idiomatic: Now that the Sovereign has just obtained the empire, to seek out one man solely because of personal resentment—what does this show of the empire's narrowness!

sentences.zh: 且以季布之賢而漢求之急如此，此不北走胡即南走越耳。

translations.literal: Moreover with Ji Bu's worthiness and Han seek him urgent like this, this not north flee Hu then south flee Yue only.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, with Ji Bu's worthiness and the urgency with which Han seeks him like this, he will either flee north to the Hu or south to Yue.

sentences.zh: 夫忌壯士以資敵國，此伍子胥所以鞭荊平王之墓也。

translations.literal: Indeed fear brave warriors thereby aid enemy states, this Wu Zixu therefore whipped Jing Ping Wang's tomb.
translations.idiomatic: To begrudge brave warriors and thereby strengthen enemy states—this is why Wu Zixu later whipped the tomb of King Ping of Chu.

sentences.zh: 君何不從容為上言邪？」

translations.literal: You sir why not leisurely for Sovereign speak?'
translations.idiomatic: Why don't you speak to the Sovereign about this at your leisure?'

sentences.zh: 汝陰侯滕公心知朱家大俠，意季布匿其所，乃許曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Ruyin Hou Teng Gong heart knew Zhu Jia great knight-errant, suspected Ji Bu concealed his place, then promised said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Ruyin, Teng Gong, knew in his heart that Zhu Jia was a great knight-errant, and suspected that Ji Bu was hiding in his home. He then agreed, saying, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 待閒，果言如朱家指。

translations.literal: Waited leisure, indeed spoke as Zhu Jia pointed.
translations.idiomatic: He waited for a leisurely moment, and indeed spoke as Zhu Jia had directed.

sentences.zh: 上乃赦季布。

translations.literal: Sovereign then pardoned Ji Bu.
translations.idiomatic: The Sovereign then pardoned Ji Bu.

sentences.zh: 當是時，諸公皆多季布能摧剛為柔，朱家亦以此名聞當世。

translations.literal: At this time, various nobles all praised Ji Bu able bend hard become soft, Zhu Jia also by this name heard current age.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, all the nobles praised Ji Bu for his ability to bend the unyielding and make it yielding, and Zhu Jia also gained fame in the present age through this.

sentences.zh: 季布召見，謝，上拜為郎中。

translations.literal: Ji Bu summoned audience, thanked, Sovereign appointed as lang zhong.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu was summoned for an audience and expressed thanks. The Sovereign appointed him as a lang zhong (court attendant).

sentences.zh: 孝惠時，為中郎將。

translations.literal: Filial Hui time, served as zhong lang jiang.
translations.idiomatic: During Emperor Hui's reign, he served as zhong lang jiang (lieutenant general).

sentences.zh: 單于嘗為書嫚呂后，不遜，呂后大怒，召諸將議之。

translations.literal: Chanyu once made letter insulted Empress Lü, not respectful, Empress Lü greatly angered, summoned various generals discussed it.
translations.idiomatic: The Chanyu once wrote a letter insulting Empress Lü in disrespectful terms. Empress Lü was greatly angered and summoned all the generals to discuss it.

sentences.zh: 上將軍樊噲曰：「臣願得十萬眾，橫行匈奴中。」

translations.literal: Supreme general Fan Kuai said: 'Minister wishes obtain ten myriad multitude, rampage Xiongnu midst.'
translations.idiomatic: The Supreme General, Fan Kuai, said, 'I wish to obtain a force of 100,000 men and rampage through the Xiongnu lands.'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆阿呂后意，曰「然」。

translations.literal: Various generals all flattered Empress Lü's intention, said 'Yes'.
translations.idiomatic: All the generals flattered Empress Lü's wishes and said, 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 季布曰：「樊噲可斬也！

translations.literal: Ji Bu said: 'Fan Kuai can behead!
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu said, 'Fan Kuai should be executed!'

sentences.zh: 夫高帝將兵四十餘萬眾，困於平城，今噲柰何以十萬眾橫行匈奴中，面欺！

translations.literal: Indeed Gao Emperor led troops forty more myriad multitude, trapped at Pingcheng, now Kuai how with ten myriad multitude rampage Xiongnu midst, face deceive!
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, when the Gao Emperor led over 400,000 troops, he was trapped at Pingcheng. Now how can Kuai with 100,000 men rampage through the Xiongnu lands? This is barefaced deception!'

sentences.zh: 且秦以事於胡，陳勝等起。

translations.literal: Moreover Qin because engaged with Hu, Chen Sheng and others arose.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Qin was destroyed because they were engaged with the Hu, allowing Chen Sheng and others to rise up.

sentences.zh: 于今創痍未瘳，噲又面諛，欲搖動天下。」

translations.literal: To now wounds sores not healed, Kuai moreover face flatter, wishes shake move tianxia.'
translations.idiomatic: Even now our wounds have not healed, and Kuai is once again flattering to the face, wishing to shake and destabilize the empire.'

sentences.zh: 是時殿上皆恐，太后罷朝，遂不復議擊匈奴事。

translations.literal: At this time hall above all feared, Empress Dowager dismissed court, then no again discussed attack Xiongnu matters.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, all in the hall were terrified. The Empress Dowager dismissed the court, and they never again discussed attacking the Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: 季布為河東守，孝文時，人有言其賢者，孝文召，欲以為御史大夫。

translations.literal: Ji Bu served as Hedong governor, Filial Wen time, people had spoke his worthiness, Filial Wen summoned, wished appoint as Yushi Dafu.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu served as governor of Hedong. During Emperor Wen's reign, people spoke of his worthiness, so Emperor Wen summoned him, intending to appoint him as Yushi Dafu (Censor-in-Chief).

sentences.zh: 復有言其勇，使酒難近。

translations.literal: Again had spoke his bravery, made wine difficult approach.
translations.idiomatic: Others again spoke of his bravery, but said that when he drank wine he was difficult to approach.

sentences.zh: 至，留邸一月，見罷。

translations.literal: Arrived, detained guesthouse one month, audience dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived and was detained at the guesthouse for a month, then given an audience and dismissed.

sentences.zh: 季布因進曰：「臣無功竊寵，待罪河東。

translations.literal: Ji Bu then advanced said: 'Minister no merit stealthily favored, awaiting punishment Hedong.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu then stepped forward and said, 'I have no merit but have stealthily received favor, awaiting punishment in Hedong.'

sentences.zh: 陛下無故召臣，此人必有以臣欺陛下者；

translations.literal: Your Majesty without cause summoned minister, this person must have with minister deceived Your Majesty;
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty summoned me without cause—this person must have deceived Your Majesty about me;'

sentences.zh: 今臣至，無所受事，罷去，此人必有以毀臣者。

translations.literal: Now minister arrived, nothing received matters, dismissed go, this person must have slandered minister.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have arrived and received no assignments, then been dismissed—this person must have slandered me.'

sentences.zh: 夫陛下以一人之譽而召臣，一人之毀而去臣，臣恐天下有識聞之有以闚陛下也。」

translations.literal: Indeed Your Majesty with one person's praise summoned minister, one person's slander dismissed minister, minister fears tianxia have knowledge hear it have means peek Your Majesty.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, for Your Majesty to summon me because of one person's praise and dismiss me because of one person's slander—I fear that those with knowledge throughout the empire who hear of this will have means to peek at Your Majesty's character.'

sentences.zh: 上默然慚，良久曰：「河東吾股肱郡，故特召君耳。」

translations.literal: Sovereign silently ashamed, good while said: 'Hedong my limbs commandery, therefore specially summoned you.'
translations.idiomatic: The Sovereign was silently ashamed. After a long while he said, 'Hedong is my most important commandery, so I specially summoned you.'

sentences.zh: 布辭之官。

translations.literal: Bu declined returned office.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu declined and returned to his office.

sentences.zh: 楚人曹丘生，辯士，數招權顧金錢。

translations.literal: Chu person Cao Qiu Sheng, debater, repeatedly attracted power looked gold money.
translations.idiomatic: Cao Qiu Sheng of Chu was a persuasive rhetorician who repeatedly attracted power and sought gold and money.

sentences.zh: 事貴人趙同等，與竇長君善。

translations.literal: Served noble persons Zhao Tong and others, with Dou Changjun good.
translations.idiomatic: He served noble persons like Zhao Tong and was on good terms with Dou Changjun.

sentences.zh: 季布聞之，寄書諫竇長君曰：「吾聞曹丘生非長者，勿與通。」

translations.literal: Ji Bu heard this, sent letter admonished Dou Changjun said: 'I heard Cao Qiu Sheng not upright person, do not with communicate.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu heard this and sent a letter admonishing Dou Changjun, saying, 'I have heard that Cao Qiu Sheng is not an upright person—do not associate with him.'

sentences.zh: 及曹丘生歸，欲得書請季布。

translations.literal: When Cao Qiu Sheng returned, wished obtain letter request Ji Bu.
translations.idiomatic: When Cao Qiu Sheng returned, he wished to obtain a letter to request an introduction to Ji Bu.

sentences.zh: 竇長君曰：「季將軍不說足下，足下無往。」

translations.literal: Dou Changjun said: 'Ji general not pleased you, you no go.'
translations.idiomatic: Dou Changjun said, 'General Ji is not pleased with you—you should not go.'

sentences.zh: 固請書，遂行。

translations.literal: Firmly requested letter, then went.
translations.idiomatic: He firmly requested the letter and then went.

sentences.zh: 使人先發書，季布果大怒，待曹丘。

translations.literal: Sent person first sent letter, Ji Bu indeed greatly angered, waited Cao Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: He sent someone to deliver the letter first, and Ji Bu indeed became greatly angered, waiting for Cao Qiu.

sentences.zh: 曹丘至，即揖季布曰：「楚人諺曰『得黃金百（斤），不如得季布一諾』，足下何以得此聲於梁楚閒哉？

translations.literal: Cao Qiu arrived, immediately bowed Ji Bu said: 'Chu people proverb says 'obtain yellow gold hundred (jin), not as obtain Ji Bu one promise', you sir how obtained this reputation in Liang Chu between?
translations.idiomatic: Cao Qiu arrived and immediately bowed to Ji Bu, saying, 'The Chu people have a proverb: "Getting a hundred jin of yellow gold is not as good as getting one promise from Ji Bu." How did you, sir, obtain this reputation between Liang and Chu?'

sentences.zh: 且仆楚人，足下亦楚人也。

translations.literal: Moreover I Chu person, you sir also Chu person.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I am a Chu person, and you, sir, are also a Chu person.'

sentences.zh: 仆游揚足下之名於天下，顧不重邪？

translations.literal: I travel spread you sir's name in tianxia, but not heavy?
translations.idiomatic: I have traveled and spread your reputation throughout the empire—is this not a weighty matter?'

sentences.zh: 何足下距仆之深也！」

translations.literal: Why you sir reject I so deep!'
translations.idiomatic: Why do you, sir, reject me so deeply!'

sentences.zh: 季布乃大說，引入，留數月，為上客，厚送之。

translations.literal: Ji Bu then greatly pleased, led in, detained several months, treated as honored guest, richly sent off.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu was then greatly pleased, led him in, detained him for several months, treated him as an honored guest, and richly sent him off.

sentences.zh: 季布名所以益聞者，曹丘揚之也。

translations.literal: Ji Bu reputation reason increasingly heard, Cao Qiu spread it.
translations.idiomatic: The reason Ji Bu's reputation became increasingly well-known was that Cao Qiu spread it.

sentences.zh: 季布弟季心，氣蓋關中，遇人恭謹，為任俠，方數千里，士皆爭為之死。

translations.literal: Ji Bu younger brother Ji Xin, spirit covered Guanzhong, met people respectful prudent, acted as knight-errant, area several thousand li, scholars all contended for him die.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu's younger brother Ji Xin had spirit that covered all of Guanzhong. He met people with respectful prudence, acted as a knight-errant, and over an area of several thousand li, all the scholars contended to die for him.

sentences.zh: 嘗殺人，亡之吳，從袁絲匿。

translations.literal: Once killed person, fled to Wu, followed Yuan Si concealed.
translations.idiomatic: He once killed a person, fled to Wu, and hid with Yuan Si.

sentences.zh: 長事袁絲，弟畜灌夫、籍福之屬。

translations.literal: Long served Yuan Si, moreover gathered Guan Fu, Ji Fu and others.
translations.idiomatic: He long served Yuan Si and moreover gathered followers like Guan Fu and Ji Fu.

sentences.zh: 嘗為中司馬，中尉郅都不敢不加禮。

translations.literal: Once served as zhong sima, zhong wei Zhi Bu dared not not add rites.
translations.idiomatic: He once served as zhong sima, and even the zhong wei Zhi Bu dared not fail to show him proper respect.

sentences.zh: 少年多時時竊籍其名以行。

translations.literal: Young men often from time to time secretly borrowed his name to act.
translations.idiomatic: Young men often secretly borrowed his name from time to time to carry out their affairs.

sentences.zh: 當是時，季心以勇，布以諾，著聞關中。

translations.literal: At this time, Ji Xin with bravery, Bu with promises, prominently heard Guanzhong.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Ji Xin was known for bravery and Ji Bu for keeping his word—their reputations were prominent throughout Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 季布母弟丁公，為楚將。

translations.literal: Ji Bu mother's younger brother Ding Gong, served as Chu general.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Bu's mother's younger brother Ding Gong served as a Chu general.

sentences.zh: 丁公為項羽逐窘高祖彭城西，短兵接，高祖急，顧丁公曰：「兩賢豈相戹哉！」

translations.literal: Ding Gong for Xiang Yu pursued distressed Gaozu Pengcheng west, close combat met, Gaozu urgent, looked back Ding Gong said: 'Two worthy men how mutually distress!'
translations.idiomatic: Ding Gong, for Xiang Yu, pursued and distressed Gaozu west of Pengcheng. They met in close combat, Gaozu was urgent, and he looked back at Ding Gong, saying, 'How can two worthy men distress each other like this!'

sentences.zh: 於是丁公引兵而還，漢王遂解去。

translations.literal: Then Ding Gong led troops returned, Han King then escaped.
translations.idiomatic: So Ding Gong led his troops back, and the Han King thus escaped.

sentences.zh: 及項王滅，丁公謁見高祖。

translations.literal: When Xiang Wang extinguished, Ding Gong audience saw Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Yu was destroyed, Ding Gong went for an audience with Gaozu.

sentences.zh: 高祖以丁公徇軍中，曰：「丁公為項王臣不忠，使項王失天下者，乃丁公也。」

translations.literal: Gaozu with Ding Gong paraded army midst, said: 'Ding Gong served Xiang Wang minister not loyal, caused Xiang Wang lose tianxia, is Ding Gong.'
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu had Ding Gong paraded before the army and said, 'Ding Gong served as Xiang Yu's minister disloyally, and the one who caused Xiang Yu to lose the empire is Ding Gong.'

sentences.zh: 遂斬丁公，曰：「使後世為人臣者無效丁公！」

translations.literal: Then beheaded Ding Gong, said: 'Cause future generations serve as ministers none emulate Ding Gong!'
translations.idiomatic: Then he beheaded Ding Gong, saying, 'Let this cause future generations who serve as ministers to not emulate Ding Gong!'

sentences.zh: 欒布者，梁人也。

translations.literal: Luan Bu was a Liang person.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Bu was a man of Liang.

sentences.zh: 始梁王彭越為家人時，嘗與布游。

translations.literal: Beginning Liang King Peng Yue as commoner time, once with Bu roamed.
translations.idiomatic: When the Liang King Peng Yue was still a commoner, he once roamed with Bu.

sentences.zh: 窮困，賃傭於齊，為酒人保。

translations.literal: Impoverished distressed, hired labor in Qi, served as tavern security.
translations.idiomatic: He was impoverished and distressed, hired himself out as labor in Qi, and served as security at a tavern.

sentences.zh: 數歲，彭越去之巨野中為盜，而布為人所略賣，為奴於燕。

translations.literal: Several years, Peng Yue went to Juye midst became bandit, and Bu by people abducted sold, became slave in Yan.
translations.idiomatic: After several years, Peng Yue went into the Juye marshes to become a bandit, while Bu was abducted and sold by people, becoming a slave in Yan.

sentences.zh: 為其家主報仇，燕將臧荼舉以為都尉。

translations.literal: For his household master avenged, Yan general Zang Tu recommended as du wei.
translations.idiomatic: He avenged his household master, and the Yan general Zang Tu recommended him to serve as du wei.

sentences.zh: 臧荼後為燕王，以布為將。

translations.literal: Zang Tu later became Yan King, appointed Bu as general.
translations.idiomatic: Zang Tu later became King of Yan and appointed Bu as his general.

sentences.zh: 及臧荼反，漢擊燕，虜布。

translations.literal: When Zang Tu rebelled, Han attacked Yan, captured Bu.
translations.idiomatic: When Zang Tu rebelled, Han attacked Yan and captured Bu.

sentences.zh: 梁王彭越聞之，乃言上，請贖布以為梁大夫。

translations.literal: Liang King Peng Yue heard this, then spoke Sovereign, requested redeem Bu to serve as Liang daifu.
translations.idiomatic: The Liang King Peng Yue heard this and then spoke to the Sovereign, requesting to redeem Bu to serve as a Liang daifu (minister).

sentences.zh: 使於齊，未還，漢召彭越，責以謀反，夷三族。

translations.literal: Sent to Qi, not yet returned, Han summoned Peng Yue, blamed with plotting rebellion, exterminated three clans.
translations.idiomatic: He was sent on a mission to Qi and had not yet returned when Han summoned Peng Yue, blamed him for plotting rebellion, and exterminated his three clans.

sentences.zh: 已而梟彭越頭於雒陽下，詔曰：「有敢收視者，輒捕之。」

translations.literal: Soon displayed Peng Yue's head at Luoyang below, decree said: 'Have dared collect view, immediately capture them.'
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, Peng Yue's head was displayed below Luoyang, and a decree said, 'Anyone who dares to collect or view it will be immediately captured.'

sentences.zh: 布從齊還，奏事彭越頭下，祠而哭之。

translations.literal: Bu from Qi returned, memorialized affairs Peng Yue head below, sacrificed and wept for him.
translations.idiomatic: Bu returned from Qi and, while memorializing affairs below Peng Yue's head, performed sacrifices and wept for him.

sentences.zh: 吏捕布以聞。

translations.literal: Officials captured Bu to report.
translations.idiomatic: The officials captured Bu and reported it.

sentences.zh: 上召布，罵曰：「若與彭越反邪？

translations.literal: Sovereign summoned Bu, cursed said: 'You with Peng Yue rebelled?'
translations.idiomatic: The Sovereign summoned Bu and cursed him, saying, 'Did you rebel with Peng Yue?'

sentences.zh: 吾禁人勿收，若獨祠而哭之，與越反明矣。

translations.literal: I prohibited people not collect, you alone sacrificed and wept for him, with Yue rebel clear.
translations.idiomatic: I prohibited people from collecting it, but you alone sacrificed and wept for him—it's clear you rebelled with Yue.'

sentences.zh: 趣亨之。」

translations.literal: Hurry execute him.'
translations.idiomatic: Hurry and execute him.'

sentences.zh: 方提趣湯，布顧曰：「願一言而死。」

translations.literal: Just about led hurry cauldron, Bu looked back said: 'Wish one word then die.'
translations.idiomatic: Just as they were leading him to hurry to the cauldron, Bu looked back and said, 'I wish to speak one word before I die.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「何言？」

translations.literal: Sovereign said: 'What words?'
translations.idiomatic: The Sovereign said, 'What words?'

sentences.zh: 布曰：「方上之困於彭城，敗滎陽、成皋閒，項王所以（遂）不能［遂］西，徒以彭王居梁地，與漢合從苦楚也。

translations.literal: Bu said: 'Just Sovereign's distress at Pengcheng, defeated between Xingyang, Chenggao, Xiang Wang reason not able west, only because Peng King dwelt Liang lands, with Han allied together afflicted Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Bu said, 'When the Sovereign was distressed at Pengcheng and defeated between Xingyang and Chenggao, the reason Xiang Yu could not advance west was only because the Peng King dwelt in Liang lands and allied with Han to afflict Chu.'

sentences.zh: 當是之時，彭王一顧，與楚則漢破，與漢而楚破。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng King one glance, allied with Chu then Han broken, allied with Han then Chu broken.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, with just one glance from the Peng King, if he allied with Chu then Han would be broken, if he allied with Han then Chu would be broken.'

sentences.zh: 且垓下之會，微彭王，項氏不亡。

translations.literal: Moreover Gaixia meeting, without Peng King, Xiang clan not perished.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, at the Gaixia meeting, without the Peng King, the Xiang clan would not have perished.'

sentences.zh: 天下已定，彭王剖符受封，亦欲傳之萬世。

translations.literal: Tianxia already settled, Peng King divided tally received fief, also wished transmit to ten thousand generations.
translations.idiomatic: The empire was already settled, the Peng King had his tally divided and received his fief, and he also wished to transmit it to ten thousand generations.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下一徵兵於梁，彭王病不行，而陛下疑以為反，反形未見，以苛小案誅滅之，臣恐功臣人人自危也。

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty one summoned troops from Liang, Peng King ill not go, and Your Majesty suspected as rebellion, rebellion form not seen, with harsh petty case exterminated him, minister fears merit ministers each person self endangered.
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty summoned troops just once from Liang, the Peng King was ill and did not go, yet Your Majesty suspected him of rebellion. The shape of rebellion was not seen, but you exterminated him with a harsh and petty case. I fear all the merit ministers will each feel endangered.'

sentences.zh: 今彭王已死，臣生不如死，請就亨。」

translations.literal: Now Peng King already dead, minister living not as dying, please proceed boil.'
translations.idiomatic: Now that the Peng King is already dead, living is not as good as dying for me. Please proceed with the boiling.'

sentences.zh: 於是上乃釋布罪，拜為都尉。

translations.literal: Then Sovereign released Bu's crime, appointed as du wei.
translations.idiomatic: So the Sovereign released Bu from his crime and appointed him as du wei.

sentences.zh: 孝文時，為燕相，至將軍。

translations.literal: Filial Wen time, served as Yan prime minister, rose to general.
translations.idiomatic: During Emperor Wen's reign, he served as prime minister of Yan and rose to the rank of general.

sentences.zh: 布乃稱曰：「窮困不能辱身下志，非人也；

translations.literal: Bu then declared: 'Impoverished distressed cannot humiliate self lower ambitions, not person;
translations.idiomatic: Bu then declared, 'If poverty and distress cannot humiliate one's self or lower one's ambitions, that is not human;'

sentences.zh: 富貴不能快意，非賢也。」

translations.literal: Wealth nobility cannot delight intentions, not worthy.'
translations.idiomatic: If wealth and nobility cannot delight one's intentions, that is not worthy.'

sentences.zh: 於是嘗有德者厚報之，有怨者必以法滅之。

translations.literal: Then once had virtue ones thickly repaid them, had grievances ones must with law extinguished them.
translations.idiomatic: So he thickly repaid those who had once shown him virtue, and those who had grievances against him he certainly extinguished with the law.

sentences.zh: 吳（軍）［楚］反時，以軍功封俞侯，復為燕相。

translations.literal: Wu (army) [Chu] rebellion time, with military merit enfeoffed Yu Hou, again served as Yan prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: During the time of the Wu [Chu] rebellion, he was enfeoffed as Marquis of Yu for military merit, and again served as prime minister of Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕齊之閒皆為欒布立社，號曰欒公社。

translations.literal: Yan Qi between all for Luan Bu established shrines, styled Luan Gong shrines.
translations.idiomatic: Between Yan and Qi, all established shrines for Luan Bu, calling them the Luan Gong shrines.

sentences.zh: 景帝中五年薨。

translations.literal: Jing Emperor middle fifth year passed away.
translations.idiomatic: He passed away in the fifth year of Emperor Jing's reign.

sentences.zh: 子賁嗣，為太常，犧牲不如令，國除。

translations.literal: Son Ben succeeded, served as Grand Master of Ceremonies, sacrifices not according to regulations, fief eliminated.
translations.idiomatic: His son Ben succeeded him and served as Grand Master of Ceremonies, but his sacrifices did not conform to regulations, so his fief was eliminated.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：以項羽之氣，而季布以勇顯於楚，身屨（典）軍搴旗者數矣，可謂壯士。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: With Xiang Yu's spirit, yet Ji Bu with bravery prominent in Chu, personally led troops seized banners several times, can be called stalwart warrior.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: With Xiang Yu's spirit, Ji Bu nonetheless became prominent in Chu through bravery, personally leading troops and seizing enemy banners on several occasions—he can truly be called a stalwart warrior.

sentences.zh: 然至被刑戮，為人奴而不死，何其下也！

translations.literal: However to suffered punishment execution, became person's slave yet not died, how lowly!
translations.idiomatic: Yet to suffer punishment and execution, become someone's slave and not die—how lowly this was!

sentences.zh: 彼必自負其材，故受辱而不羞，欲有所用其未足也，故終為漢名將。

translations.literal: He certainly self-relied on his talents, therefore accepted humiliation without shame, wished to have use for his insufficiency, therefore finally became Han famous general.
translations.idiomatic: He certainly relied upon his own talents, therefore accepted humiliation without feeling shame, wishing to have some use for what was still insufficient, and therefore finally became a famous general of Han.

sentences.zh: 賢者誠重其死。

translations.literal: Worthy ones truly value their death.
translations.idiomatic: Truly, the worthy value their death.

sentences.zh: 夫婢妾賤人感慨而自殺者，非能勇也，其計畫無復之耳。

translations.literal: Indeed concubines base people emotionally moved commit suicide, not able brave, their plans no recovery only.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, when concubines and base people are emotionally moved and commit suicide, it is not that they are able to be brave—their plans simply have no recovery.

sentences.zh: 欒布哭彭越，趣湯如歸者，彼誠知所處，不自重其死。

translations.literal: Luan Bu wept Peng Yue, hurried to cauldron as returning home, he truly knew his situation, not self-valued his death.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Bu wept for Peng Yue and hurried to the cauldron as if returning home—he truly knew his situation and did not value his own death.

sentences.zh: 雖往古烈士，何以加哉！

translations.literal: Even past ancient fierce warriors, how to add!
translations.idiomatic: Even the fierce warriors of past and ancient times—what could be added to this!
